title: LG's OLED TV shows the highlights and shadows of HDR
text:
1 of 9 LG's OLED TV shows the highlights and shadows of HDR Take a look at LG's OLED televisions, which claim to show off the eye-popping contrast of high dynamic range movies and TV. Read Less 
BERLIN -- This is LG's OLED TV with high dynamic range (HDR), which is set to be the next big thing in televisions. Published: September 3, 2015 1:54 AM PDT Photo by: Rich Trenholm/CNET / Caption by: Rich Trenholm 
LG's OLED TVs with HDR aim to give you a rich and life-like contrast between deep dark shadows and bright white highlights on the same screen. Published: September 3, 2015 1:54 AM PDT Photo by: Rich Trenholm/CNET / Caption by: Rich Trenholm 
Unlike recent TV innovations like high definition and 4K, HDR isn't about adding more pixels: it's about doing more with the pixels you have. Published: September 3, 2015 1:54 AM PDT Photo by: Rich Trenholm/CNET / Caption by: Rich Trenholm 
OLED TVs like this one are well suited to HDR because the strength of OLED TVs is producing a perfectly dark shade of black and a very bright white on the screen at the same time. Published: September 3, 2015 1:54 AM PDT Photo by: Rich Trenholm/CNET / Caption by: Rich Trenholm 
There isn't a huge amount of content yet that shows off the new technology, but Amazon Instant Video is leading the way and LG says Hollywood studios are on board. Published: September 3, 2015 1:54 AM PDT Photo by: Rich Trenholm/CNET / Caption by: Rich Trenholm 
Here you can see the difference between an LCD TV on the left and an OLED TV on the right. It's worth noting, though, that this is a demonstration by LG. So of course it's designed to show off the OLED TVs in their best light. Published: September 3, 2015 1:54 AM PDT Photo by: Rich Trenholm/CNET / Caption by: Rich Trenholm 
Adding HDR makes a clear difference to movies and TV. The brighter highlights really pop from the screen without losing the solid black shadows that provide such a pleasing contrast. Published: September 3, 2015 1:54 AM PDT Photo by: Rich Trenholm/CNET / Caption by: Rich Trenholm 
Here you can see how slim the OLED TVs are. Published: September 3, 2015 1:54 AM PDT Photo by: Rich Trenholm/CNET / Caption by: Rich Trenholm 
The contrast between those shining highlights and deep shadows gives an almost 3D-like depth to the picture. 
For more from IFA 2015, check out CNET's complete coverage . Published: September 3, 2015 1:54 AM PDT Photo by: Rich Trenholm/CNET / Caption by: Rich Trenholm Hot Galleries
